intro: Arethusa biplumata, commonly known as the two-flowered arethusa, is a rare aquatic plant found in freshwater habitats. It is characterized by its delicate, ribbon-like leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in shallow, still waters with sandy or muddy substrates. Arethusa biplumata is a member of the water lily family and is known for its unique reproductive structures. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
